caller_intent: Elia wants to remove full coverage from her husband's 2014 Tundra and switch to liability insurance, while also seeking lower home insurance rates with National General.
resolution_steps: Agent confirmed policy details (2014 Tundra, National General, policy number provided).
Calculated new auto premium: $351/month for liability coverage on the Tundra, reducing total auto cost to $2,220.90 annually.
Checked home insurance premium: $1,408 annually (or $352 every three months) on a four-pay plan.
Agent agreed to explore options for lowering home insurance rates.
knowledge_required: Auto insurance coverage types (full vs. liability)
Home insurance rate factors and discount eligibility
summary: Elia requested to downgrade her husband's Tundra from full coverage to liability insurance, resulting in a $351/month savings. She also expressed concern about high home insurance rates ($1,408 annually) and requested assistance finding a better provider. The agent confirmed the auto change and agreed to investigate home insurance options.
